Job Description

About Us:

FLAG is a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to excellence in the industries we serve. Our Fullerton office is expanding, and we’re seeking a talented HR Generalist to join our team. We offer a collaborative environment where your expertise will be valued, and your professional growth is encouraged.

Job Summary:

As an HR Generalist at FLAG, you will play a crucial role in supporting our employees and management team. You’ll be responsible for a variety of HR functions, including recruitment, employee relations, benefits administration, and compliance. This position requires a hands-on professional with strong communication skills and a deep understanding of HR best practices.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Recruitment and Onboarding: Manage full-cycle recruitment, including job postings, candidate screenings, interviews, and onboarding of new employees.
  • Employee Relations: Act as a point of contact for employee concerns, ensuring a positive workplace culture and addressing issues promptly.
  • Benefits Administration: Administer employee benefits programs, including health insurance, retirement plans, and wellness initiatives.
  • HR Compliance: Ensure company compliance with federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations, maintaining up-to-date records and policies.
  • Performance Management: Support managers in the performance review process, providing guidance and documentation as needed.
  • Training and Development: Identify training needs and facilitate professional development opportunities for employees.
  • HR Reporting: Prepare and analyze HR metrics and reports to support decision-making processes.

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or a related field.
  • 3+ years of experience in an HR Generalist role or similar HR capacity.
  • Strong knowledge of HR practices, labor laws, and employee relations.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Proficient in HRIS systems and Microsoft Office Suite.
  • Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and integrity.
  • PHR or SHRM-CP certification is a plus.

Why Join Us?

  • Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
  • Opportunity to be part of a growing team in a collaborative and supportive environment.
  • Career advancement and professional development opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic and fast-paced industry.

How to Apply:

If you’re a proactive and driven HR professional looking to make an impact, we’d love to hear from you! Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your qualifications and interest in the role.
